page.title: 14CORNISH DIALECT AND RECIPES
page.content: {Words in use today and their meanings. burras-clay tips; chuck-throw; cluckied-stooped down; clunk-swallow; dreckly-presently,later;fuzzies-gorse; giss-get;gurt-great;holla'd out -shouted; lampered-thickly covered in dust;lew hedge-sheltered hedge;mazed- mad,furious; mykies-mica dams;ninny- fool;no cop-useless;nort-nothing; scat-knock or hit;shada-shadow; skit-skip,hurry along; slock- to entice; smeech- unpleasant odour; squallin-crying; squeezed home-shut tightly; squinned-squinted; taisy- bad tempered; tay-tea; teddy oggy- potato pasty; turmut-turnip; wisht- in poor condition. A local recipe is turmut and teddy pie, consisting of meat, potato and turnip under short crust pastry.The Cornish pasty,blackberry and apple pie are regular,traditional items of diet.
